intro: Galium verum f. trachycarpum, commonly known as the rough-seeded bedstraw, is a variant of the common bedstraw. It is a low-growing herbaceous plant characterized by its slender stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it easily distinguishable from other members of the Rubiaceae family.
